009package Ch08_BinaryRegions;
010
011
012import java.util.List;
013
014import ij.IJ;
015import ij.ImagePlus;
016import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
017import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
018import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
019import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D;
021import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
022import imagingbook.common.regions.BinaryRegion;
023import imagingbook.common.regions.segment.BinaryRegionSegmentation;
024import imagingbook.common.regions.segment.BreadthFirstSegmentation;
025import imagingbook.common.regions.segment.DepthFirstSegmentation;
026import imagingbook.common.regions.segment.Display;
027import imagingbook.common.regions.segment.RecursiveSegmentation;
028import imagingbook.common.regions.segment.RegionContourSegmentation;
029import imagingbook.common.regions.segment.SequentialSegmentation;
030
031/**
032 * <p>
033 * This ImageJ plugin demonstrates the use of the region
034 * labeling classes in the imagingbook's "regions" package:
035 * </p>
036 * <ul>
037 * <li>{@link BreadthFirstSegmentation},</li>
038 * <li>{@link DepthFirstSegmentation},</li>
039 * <li>{@link RecursiveSegmentation},</li>
040 * <li>{@link RegionContourSegmentation},</li>
041 * <li>{@link SequentialSegmentation}.</li>
042 * </ul>
043 * One of four labeling types can be selected (see the {@link #run(ImageProcessor)} method).
044 * All should produce the same results (except {@link RegionContourSegmentation},
045 * which may run out of memory easily).
046 * Requires a binary (segmented) image.
047 * 
048 * @author WB
049 * @version 2020/12/20
050 * 
051 */
052public class Region_Segmentation_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
053        
054        public enum LabelingMethod {
055                BreadthFirst, 
056                DepthFirst, 
057                Sequential,
058                RegionAndContours,
059                Recursive
060        }
061
062        public static LabelingMethod Method = LabelingMethod.BreadthFirst;
063        public static NeighborhoodType2D Neighborhood = NeighborhoodType2D.N8;
064        
065        public static boolean ColorRegions = false;
066        public static boolean ListRegions = false;
067        
068    @Override
069        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
070                return DOES_8G + NO_CHANGES;
071    }
072        
073    @Override
074        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
075        
076                if (!IjUtils.isBinary(ip)) {
077                        IJ.showMessage("Plugin requires a binary image!");
078                        return;
079                }
080                
081        if (!getUserInput())
082                return;
083        
084        if (Method == LabelingMethod.Recursive && 
085                        !IJ.showMessageWithCancel("Recursive labeling", "This may run out of stack memory!\n" + "Continue?")) {
086                        return;
087        }
088        
089        // Copy the original to a new byte image:
090        ByteProcessor bp = ip.convertToByteProcessor(false);
091        
092        
093                BinaryRegionSegmentation segmenter = null;
094                switch(Method) {
095                case BreadthFirst :     
096                        segmenter = new BreadthFirstSegmentation(bp, Neighborhood); break;
097                case DepthFirst :               
098                        segmenter = new DepthFirstSegmentation(bp, Neighborhood); break;
099                case Sequential :               
100                        segmenter = new SequentialSegmentation(bp, Neighborhood); break;
101                case RegionAndContours : 
102                        segmenter = new RegionContourSegmentation(bp, Neighborhood); break;
103                case Recursive : 
104                        segmenter = new RecursiveSegmentation(bp, Neighborhood); break;
105                }
106
107                // Retrieve the list of detected regions:
108                List<BinaryRegion> regions = segmenter.getRegions(true);        // regions are sorted by size
109                
110                if (regions == null || regions.isEmpty()) {
111                        IJ.showMessage("No regions detected!");
112                        return;
113                }
114                
115                if (ListRegions) {
116                        IJ.log("Regions sorted by size: " + regions.size());
117                        for (BinaryRegion r: regions) {
118                                IJ.log(r.toString());
119                        }
120                }
121                
122                // Show the resulting labeling as a random color image
123                ImageProcessor labelIp = Display.makeLabelImage(segmenter, ColorRegions);
124                (new ImagePlus(Method.name(), labelIp)).show();
125                
126                // Example for processing all regions:
127//              for (BinaryRegion r : regions) {
128//                      double mu11 = mu_11(r); // example for calculating region statistics (see below)
129//                      IJ.log("Region " + r.getLabel() + ": mu11=" + mu11);
130//              }
131    }
132    
133//      /**
134//       * This method demonstrates how a particular region's central moment
135//     * mu_11 could be calculated from the finished region labeling.
136//       * @param r a binary region
137//       * @return
138//       */
139//    private double mu_11 (BinaryRegion r) {
140//      Point ctr = r.getCenterPoint();
141//      final double xc = ctr.getX();   // centroid of this region
142//      final double yc = ctr.getY();
143//      double mu11 = 0;
144//      // iterate through all pixels of regions r:
145//      for (Point p : r) {
146//              mu11 = mu11 + (p.getX() - xc) * (p.getY() - yc);
147//      }
148//      return mu11;
149//    }
150    
151    private boolean getUserInput() {
152                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(Region_Segmentation_Demo.class.getSimpleName());
153                gd.addEnumChoice("Segmentation method", Method);
154                gd.addEnumChoice("Neighborhood type", Neighborhood);
155                gd.addCheckbox("Color result", ColorRegions);
156                gd.addCheckbox("List regions", ListRegions);
157                gd.showDialog();
158                if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
159                        return false;
160                }
161                Method = gd.getNextEnumChoice(LabelingMethod.class);
162                Neighborhood = gd.getNextEnumChoice(NeighborhoodType2D.class);
163                ColorRegions = gd.getNextBoolean();
164                ListRegions = gd.getNextBoolean();
165                return true;
166        }
167    
168    
169}
170
171
